basic.floral_language:
Sedum hispanicum 'Aureum'
Floriography: plentiful, vigorous, vigorous
Has a short plant canopy with many branches and green fleshy leaves in a rod shape closely arrange. In a cool season with adequate light, leaves turn slightly red. Grows fast, can be grown alone as a hanging plant.
Likes sunlight, when in the summer dormant period, the leaves crunch together, need shade properly under scattered light. Flowers are yellow.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white pink flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, with a great diurnal temperature range, with adequate sunlight turning to pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, no apparent period of dormancy, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
